column4: Need some help regarding an old HP that keeps losing connectivity to the Internet...all local resources work fine when Internet is lost but everything else is fine. I can ping local resources from it, other PC's can ping like Google...just this one machine cant. Ive installed XP, Ubuntu, RedHat etc so its not software...any help would be nice
you could investigate dmesg and /var/log/messages for what happend when our HP loos connectivity to the net
espetially look if interface goes down, if it is getting new DHCP lease...
its statically assigned an IP so DHCP shouldnt be an issue.
what type of net linke does it uses? Ethernet, wireless?
both heh its connected via wired to a Fonera with OpenWRT which a wireless client to a AP
i tried with another NIC and another Fonera...even a direct wired connection and it still just loses all connectivity outside my subnet.
when it loos connectivity, can you still join the AP itself?
yeah its connected and the Fonera itself still has access (ping google.com has a reply, ping google.com from the HP no reply)
does the link between the HP and the fonera still work when net is lost?
yeah, I can access the fonera fine, I can access my home network fully, its just everything outside my home network that stops working.
I know nothing about what's specific to the fonera. Is the fonera AP the default route and DNS relay for the HP or does the HP have direct acces to outside DSN services?

lets try this without the fonera since I still have the issue with a direct wired ethernet connection to my router. I have replaced everything outside the HP itself and even the NIC and OS to no avail...maybe something in the machine itself that's glitchy?

though the link between your HP and the router still is ok when you loos net connectivity. I guess there are still questions regarding DNS availability. When it loose net, did you try to ping NET IP instead of relying on host names?
yeah, the IP's do not resolve either so its not a DNS issue...I have several DNS servers running locally too and they can resolve the addresses for the HP, but the HP cant connect to the addresses.

If link doesn't go down for the LAN, I guess there is something on the lan preventing your boox from accessing the net and it is unlikely the HP itself. Another host declaring or trying to declare the same IP would interfere as well
thow hosts with the same IP on the LAN. Some client connecting the lan, obtaining a DHCP lease with th static ip your HP uses
Ive checked most everything I could think of...There all PC's are statically assigned IP's and nothing else has the same on as it. DHCP is disabled so no host should be able to grab a random IP.
I just cant figure it out :( I've changed everything in the HP aside from the mobo so Im guessing its that...Ah well, new mobos are like $20 nowdays :)
does this fonera AP provide DHCP lease for other fonera clients I guess fonera is a free AP providing free NET connectivity to unknown wireless clients
did you try providing another static IP to the HP?

I've disabled the AP function on this Fonera since I got a new Fonera+ which I use to share my Internet...And that AP is on a completely different line (its on Qwest ISP, my home network is on Comcast) so it cant be that.
yup, tried a few different IP's to no avail
heh its ok :) im just tired of racking my own brain thought Id ask someone else
